Analytical Thinking.definition: Degree of logical, hierarchical, and formal reasoning in text. Reflects cognitive structure, focus on analysis, planning, and rule-based processing.
Analytical Thinking.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness (Intellect facet) and Conscientiousness (Deliberation facet); HEXACO Openness, Conscientiousness; Enneagram Type 5 (Investigator), Type 1 (Reformer, system-building aspect). High values reflect intellectual curiosity, need for cognition, systematizing, protocolizing, and investigative stance. Low values correlate with higher Big Five Extraversion, Agreeableness, Neuroticism; HEXACO Extraversion, Agreeableness, Emotionality; Enneagram Type 4 (Individualist), 7 (Enthusiast), 9 (Peacemaker). Low values indicate narrative/experiential focus and less structural orientation.
Analytical Thinking.high: Highly structured, logical, complex, or formal communication. Emphasizes reason, analysis, and planning over spontaneity.
Analytical Thinking.low: Narrative, intuitive, informal, or associative language; less focused on logic or formal argument structure.

Confidence/Clout.definition: Level of confident, authoritative, or dominant language. Indexes social status, leadership, and assertiveness.
Confidence/Clout.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion (Assertiveness facet), low Neuroticism (Confidence facet); HEXACO Extraversion, Social Self-Esteem; Enneagram Type 3 (Performer), Type 8 (Challenger), Type 1 (moral authority). High values reflect social dominance, leadership, self-presentation. Low values correlate with higher Big Five Neuroticism, lower Extraversion; HEXACO low Extraversion; Enneagram Type 6 (Doubt), 9 (Withdrawal), 4 (Self-doubt). Low values reflect tentativeness, deference, or uncertainty.
Confidence/Clout.high: Language of authority, confidence, or status. May signal leadership, persuasion, or social dominance.
Confidence/Clout.low: Tentative, deferential, or uncertain language; lower perceived confidence or status.

Authenticity.definition: Degree to which language is perceived as honest, personal, and genuine.
Authenticity.psychometrics: High values correlate with HEXACO Honesty-Humility, low impression management, Big Five Openness (Vulnerability facet); Enneagram Type 4 (Individualist), Type 9 (Peacemaker, positive pole). High values reflect sincerity and psychological openness. Low values correlate with Big Five low Openness, low Honesty-Humility; Enneagram Type 3 (Impression Management), Type 6 (Caution). Low values reflect guardedness, impression management, and social masking.
Authenticity.high: Honest, direct, and self-revealing language; perceived sincerity and psychological openness.
Authenticity.low: Guarded, inauthentic, or socially masked language; possible impression management.

Emotional Tone.definition: Composite measure of positive versus negative emotional tone in language.
Emotional Tone.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion (positive emotion), low Neuroticism; HEXACO Extraversion, Emotionality; Enneagram Type 7 (Upbeat), 2 (Helper). Low values correlate with Big Five high Neuroticism, high Emotionality; Enneagram Type 4 (Downbeat), 6 (Pessimistic), 1 (Melancholic).
Emotional Tone.high: Positive, optimistic, and emotionally upbeat tone.
Emotional Tone.low: Negative, pessimistic, or emotionally downbeat tone.

Words Per Sentence.definition: Average number of words per sentence; reflects syntactic complexity, verbosity, or density of language.
Words Per Sentence.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness (Intellect facet), Conscientiousness (Planning facet); HEXACO Openness, Conscientiousness; Enneagram Type 5 (Analytic), Type 1 (Structured). Low values correlate with Big Five Extraversion; Enneagram Type 7 (Spontaneous), 9 (Informal).
Words Per Sentence.high: Long, complex sentences; elaborate or formal expression, possible cognitive complexity.
Words Per Sentence.low: Short, simple sentences; terse, direct, or informal communication.

Complex Vocabulary.definition: Percentage of words that are seven letters or longer; reflects vocabulary sophistication or lexical diversity.
Complex Vocabulary.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness; HEXACO Openness; Enneagram Type 5 (Intellectualization), Type 1. Low values correlate with Big Five Agreeableness, Extraversion; Enneagram Type 7 (Social), 2, 9 (Affiliative).
Complex Vocabulary.high: Frequent use of advanced or complex words; higher education or expertise.
Complex Vocabulary.low: Simple, everyday language; conversational or accessible style.

Dictionary Match Rate.definition: Percentage of words matched to the LIWC dictionary; reflects standard language use or dictionary coverage.
Dictionary Match Rate.psychometrics: High values indicate normative language use and correlate with Big Five Conscientiousness; Enneagram Type 1 (Norm-following), 5. Low values correlate with Big Five Openness (creative coinage); Enneagram Type 4 (Creative), 7 (Rule-breaking).
Dictionary Match Rate.high: Standard language, low slang or jargon; easy interpretability.
Dictionary Match Rate.low: High use of slang, jargon, neologisms, or out-of-vocabulary words.

Linguistic Content.definition: Overall proportion of linguistic content (function and content words together); measures text density.
Linguistic Content.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness; HEXACO Openness; Enneagram Type 5 (Dense language), 1. Low values correlate with Big Five Extraversion; Enneagram Type 7, 9 (Sparse language).
Linguistic Content.high: Rich, dense, and varied language use.

Function Words.definition: Proportion of function words (e.g., pronouns, articles, prepositions); measures grammatical structuring.
Function Words.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Conscientiousness, Openness (Structural complexity); Enneagram Type 1, 5 (Structure markers). Low values correlate with Big Five Extraversion; Enneagram Type 4, 7 (Intuitive, experiential).
Function Words.low: Content-heavy or fragmented style; less grammatical scaffolding.

Pronoun Usage.definition: Proportion of all pronouns (personal, impersonal, possessive); measure of social referencing and relational language.
Pronoun Usage.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Agreeableness, Extraversion; HEXACO Agreeableness, Extraversion; Enneagram Type 2, 9 (Other-focus). Low values correlate with Big Five Openness, Conscientiousness; Enneagram Type 5, 1 (Object focus).
Pronoun Usage.high: Relational, referential, or socially embedded language.

Personal Pronouns.definition: Frequency of personal pronouns (I, you, we, he, she, they); indexes self and other focus.
Personal Pronouns.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Neuroticism, Openness; HEXACO Emotionality; Enneagram Type 4, 5, 6 (Self/other focus). Low values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, Agreeableness; Enneagram Type 7, 8, 9 (External, non-self).
Personal Pronouns.high: High reference to self or others; social presence.
Personal Pronouns.low: Object or concept focus; depersonalized language.

Self-Reference.definition: Use of first-person singular pronouns; reflects self-focus and introspection.
Self-Reference.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Neuroticism, Openness; HEXACO Emotionality; Enneagram Type 4, 5, 6 (Self-focus, introspection). Low values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, Agreeableness; Enneagram Type 7, 9 (Other-orientation).

Group Reference.definition: Use of first-person plural pronouns; reflects group or collective focus.
Group Reference.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Agreeableness, Extraversion; HEXACO Agreeableness, Extraversion; Enneagram Type 2, 9 (Group identity). Low values correlate with Big Five Openness, Conscientiousness; Enneagram Type 4, 5 (Individual focus).
Group Reference.high: Group identity, communal focus, shared perspective.
Group Reference.low: Individual focus or lack of group inclusion.

Affiliation Language.definition: Words expressing desire for social bonds, belonging, or group membership.
Affiliation Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with HEXACO Agreeableness, Extraversion. Low values indicate detachment or introversion.
Affiliation Language.high: Strong desire for social connection, cooperation, inclusion; high relationship orientation.
Affiliation Language.low: Low need for social bonds, more independent or isolated.

Achievement Striving.definition: Language about striving, success, goals, ambition, or accomplishment.
Achievement Striving.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Conscientiousness. Low values indicate low ambition or passivity.
Achievement Striving.high: High drive for personal achievement, planning, ambition, task focus.
Achievement Striving.low: Lack of goal orientation, low ambition, possible passivity or lack of structure.

Dominance Language.definition: Words signaling dominance, authority, leadership, or control.
Dominance Language.psychometrics: High values correlate inversely with HEXACO Honesty-Humility, directly with Big Five Extraversion and status-seeking.
Dominance Language.high: Desire for influence, status, or control; high social assertiveness, possible dominance or narcissism.
Dominance Language.low: Deference, humility, avoidance of power displays.

Cognitive Process Words.definition: References to mental processes such as thinking, reasoning, or understanding.
Cognitive Process Words.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness (Intellect facet), Conscientiousness (Deliberation facet).

Insight Language.definition: Words expressing self-awareness, realization, or understanding.
Insight Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness and Emotionality.

Differentiation Language.definition: Language expressing contrast, complexity, or nuance.
Differentiation Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness (Intellectual humility, flexibility), Agreeableness.
Differentiation Language.high: Nuanced, complex, or open-minded thinking; capacity for perspective-taking.

Affective Language.definition: General use of emotion words; overall affective intensity and expressiveness.
Affective Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Emotionality, Neuroticism, Extraversion. Low values indicate emotional flatness or suppression.
Affective Language.low: Emotionally flat, neutral, or affect-suppressed language.

Positive Sentiment.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, low Neuroticism, higher well-being.
Positive Sentiment.high: Upbeat, optimistic, grateful, or hopeful language.
Positive Sentiment.low: Lack of positive affect, neutral or possibly negative affect focus.

Negative Sentiment.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Neuroticism or psychological distress.
Negative Sentiment.high: Negative, distressed, pessimistic, or complaining tone.
Negative Sentiment.low: Absence of negativity; could be neutral or positive.

Positive Emotion Language.definition: Explicit references to positive emotion states.
Positive Emotion Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, life satisfaction, and resilience.
Positive Emotion Language.high: Cheerful, positive, resilient affect and language.
Positive Emotion Language.low: Low positive emotional expression, emotional restraint, or dissatisfaction.

Negative Emotion Language.definition: Explicit references to negative emotion states.
Negative Emotion Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Emotionality, Neuroticism, distress.
Negative Emotion Language.high: Frequent discussion of distress, pain, or negative affect.
Negative Emotion Language.low: Low negative emotional expression; could reflect well-being or emotional suppression.

Anxiety Language.definition: Words indicating anxiety, fear, or nervousness.
Anxiety Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Neuroticism, Emotionality.
Anxiety Language.high: High trait anxiety, emotional lability, vigilance for threat.
Anxiety Language.low: Calm, secure, emotionally stable, low vigilance.

Anger Language.definition: Words indicating anger, hostility, or frustration.
Anger Language.psychometrics: High values correlate inversely with Big Five Agreeableness, directly with Emotionality.
Anger Language.high: High anger reactivity, conflict orientation, possible antagonism.

Sadness Language.definition: Words signaling sadness, grief, depression, or emotional pain.
Sadness Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Emotionality, depression risk.
Sadness Language.high: Higher depression risk, emotional vulnerability, sadness.
Sadness Language.low: Positive affect, resilience, or emotional distance.

Prosocial Language.definition: Words expressing help, support, empathy, or altruism.
Prosocial Language.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Agreeableness, HEXACO Honesty-Humility.
Prosocial Language.high: Generosity, empathy, focus on helping others, collaborative orientation.
Prosocial Language.low: Lack of empathy, self-focus, low social responsibility.

Politeness Markers.definition: Language signaling respect, courtesy, humility, or modesty.
Politeness Markers.psychometrics: High values correlate with HEXACO Honesty-Humility and Big Five Agreeableness.
Politeness Markers.high: High social grace, respect for others, self-restraint.
Politeness Markers.low: Direct, possibly blunt or disrespectful language; low deference to social norms.

Family References.definition: Mentions of family, kinship, or close familial bonds.
Family References.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Emotionality, Agreeableness.
Family References.high: Strong attachment to family, closeness, or emotional support orientation.
Family References.low: Weak or absent family focus, detachment, or independence.

Friend References.definition: Mentions of friends, social companions, or networks.
Friend References.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, Agreeableness.
Friend References.high: Strong social network focus, sociability, high positive social engagement.
Friend References.low: Few or no references to friends, possible social isolation or introversion.

Leisure Orientation.definition: References to recreation, play, hobbies, and enjoyment.
Leisure Orientation.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness (Imagination facet), Extraversion.
Leisure Orientation.high: Pleasure-seeking, recreation, creative play, well-being focus.
Leisure Orientation.low: Seriousness, work-focus, or lack of enjoyment.

Reward Orientation.definition: Language about gains, incentives, benefits, or pleasure.
Reward Orientation.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Extraversion, Conscientiousness, and behavioral approach.
Reward Orientation.high: Strong motivation for gain, pleasure, or positive reinforcement.
Reward Orientation.low: Reward insensitivity, lack of pursuit, or indifference.

Curiosity Expression.definition: References to inquiry, exploration, or learning.
Curiosity Expression.psychometrics: High values correlate with Big Five Openness, intellectual engagement.
Curiosity Expression.high: Intellectual curiosity, openness to new ideas, or learning orientation.
Curiosity Expression.low: Closed-mindedness, lack of novelty-seeking, or complacency.
